intro: Echinopsilon sedoides var. ucranicus, commonly known as the Ucranicus spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic species. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers surrounded by distinctive bracts. This variant is adapted to thrive in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
